content.description:
Sit start in pit underneath arete of Titanic boulder. Use crimps and pinches to gain obvious slot, and then use left arete and face holds to top out into slot. Walls that make up the opening of the pit are off.

 Terrifying fall potential, use discretion. Walk off counterclockwise around topper boulder.
content.location: Beautiful cleaved arete on left side of Titanic boulder.

content.description:
Stand start using triangular pocket with the left hand and arete tooth with the right. Pull on to gain face hold and proceed straight up to obvious large break. Traverse break left to exit.

 Possible to exit left early if your confidence fails you.
content.location: Obvious slab just underneath of the Three Sister boulder. Carefully pick you way through the scree to get to base.

content.description: Start low and right on face.  Ride jagged crack to the left to top out at the highest point.
content.location: Roughly road-facing side of boulder 15 feet further downhill from the Titanic arete

content.description:
Sit start on obvious left facing jug in middle of face with ledge foot. Follow path of weakness up and right to delicate topout.

 Walk off (carefully!) back and then left to exit down tiered blocks.
content.location: Middle route on Titanic block, further down trail from Slabdance

content.description:
Sit start in pit, same as Titanic. On reaching deep slot, make long transition right into good jugs (of Digits) and follow obvious weakness up and right to top out.

 Walk off back and then left.
content.location: Starts in pit directly underneath left arete of Titanic boulder.

content.description: Less traveled area furthest downhill from purple trail housing some of the scariest landings and sketchfest walkoffs in the park. Generally smooth faces with distinct holds.
